text: The Copa Higher Power (Spanish for "Cup of Higher Power") is an annual tournament promoted by the Mexican lucha libre professional wrestling promotion International Wrestling Revolution Group (IWRG). The tournament has been annual since September 1997. ==Tournament== The tournament is featured in two different forms, as a singles tournament and as a tag team tournament. It was featured as a team tournament in 1997 and in 2003 it began as a singles tournament. ==Copa Higher Power Tournament winners== {| class="wikitable sortable" width=100% !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Year !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Winner(s) !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Date !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Location !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Notes |- |1997 || Dr. Cerebro, Fantasy, Mr. Águila, Neblina and Tony Rivera || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |1998 || Judo Suwa, Lyguila, Magnum Tokyo, Ryo Saito, Shiima Nobunaga, Sumo Fujii and Último Dragón || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |1998 || Mr. Niebla, El Pantera, Shocker, El Solar, Star Boy and Mike Segura || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |1999 || Astro Rey Jr., Máscara Mágica, Rey Bucanero, El Satánico and Último Guerrero || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |2003 || Villano V || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |2004 || NOSAWA, MAZADA, Garuda & Black Tiger III || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |2006 || Marco Corleone || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |2007 || CIMA || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |2009 || Bobby Lee Jr. || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |2010 || Dr. Cerebro, El Hijo del Pantera and Trauma II || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |2010 || Silver King || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |2010 || 911 || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |2011 || Damián 666 and Lizmark, Jr. || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |2011 || La Máquina Infernal || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |2011 || Multifacético || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |2011 || Saruman || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |- |2012 || Trauma II || || Naucalpan, State of Mexico, Mexico || |} ==References== Category:International Wrestling Revolution Group tournaments
